CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 1, 1946, pg. 8, reads: "Elaborate Wedding United Prominent Couple - It was an elaborate and beautiful wedding ceremony which united popular Miss Ruth Louise Allen, daughter of Mrs. John Francis Allen, and Maurice L. Smith, son of Mrs. May A. Smith, in charming home of the bride. Shown is the wedding party, which included the matron of honor, Mrs. David Brown of Washington, D. C., bridesmaids Marjorie and Arlene Allen Gaines, nieces of the bride; flower girl Velma Jeanne Love, Emmett H. Allen, brother of the bride, Thomas Latimer, best man, and ushers George W. Gaines and John F. Allen Jr. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of wedding party with five men, including groom Maurice L. Smith, Emmett H. Allen, best man Thomas Latimer, ushers George Gaines third from right and John F. Allen Jr., four women, including bride Ruth Louise Allen wearing fingerless gloves, pearl necklace, and satin and chiffon wedding gown, matron of honor Mrs. David Brown, and bridesmaids Arlene and Marjorie Allen Gaines, and flower girl Velma Jeanne Love, posed in Allen home, Hermitage Street, Homewood
